posts.post_content:
@Leonidus; Sure they do. In fact, they print cards like this with that very thought in mind. A lot of players like combos. If its not going to rock the tournament boards, they aren't going to care. Sure, you can have infinite exarchs with two cards, but to do something with them you need a third card, or to let your opponent respond before his end step.  
EDIT; Okay, maybe you can attack with all of them since they have haste. I still don't hate this combo.

posts.post_content: Understandably, most comments here are about [Splinter Twin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Splinter Twin), but that ship has sailed. Still, this card is a powerhouse! Since rotation, the average toughness of utility creatures has dropped. Additionally, with there being a smaller card pool available now, people are falling back on the good ol' Titan cycle/and/or [Wurmcoil Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmcoil Engine) for win conditions. Exarch can reliably slow your opponent down OR cripple their defenses, whether it's by tapping down a Titan, that untapped Island they were relying on, or netting yourself two blockers they weren't expecting. 5/5
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Modern Naya Birthing Pod can utilize this to go off in a very mind-bending combo that results in a very early and reliable [Kiki-Jiki](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kiki-Jiki) style finish, albeit it will cost you 10 life.  
  
T1 [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise)  
T2 [Birthing Pod](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birthing Pod)  
T3 2-dop creature, probably [Thalia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thalia) or something.  
T4 A) Pod the Thalia into Deceiver Exarch, untapping Pod. B) Pod the Birds into [Phantasmal Image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantasmal Image), copying Exarch and untapping the Pod. C) Pod the now 3-drop Image into [Restoration Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Restoration Angel), blinking the first [Deceiver Exarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deceiver Exarch). D) Untap Pod, pod [Restoration Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Restoration Angel) into [Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker). Proceed to combo off with Exarch the old fashioned way.  
  
In my own [Numot, the Devastator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Numot, the Devastator) EDH, this guy does double duty as both a [Splinter Twin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Splinter Twin ) target and helping Numot punch through [Maze of Ith/auto](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maze of Ith/auto)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Modern Naya Birthing Pod can utilize this to go off in a very mind-bending combo that results in a very early and reliable Kiki-Jiki style finish, albeit it will cost you 10 life.

T1 Birds of Paradise
T2 Birthing Pod
T3 2-dop creature, probably Thalia or something.
T4 A) Pod the Thalia into Deceiver Exarch, untapping Pod. B) Pod the Birds into Phantasmal Image, copying Exarch and untapping the Pod. C) Pod the now 3-drop Image into Restoration Angel, blinking the first Deceiver Exarch. D) Untap Pod, pod Restoration Angel into Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker. Proceed to combo off with Exarch the old fashioned way.

In my own Numot, the Devastator EDH, this guy does double duty as both a Splinter Twin target and helping Numot punch through Maze of Ith/auto... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Would this count as a spell that (while on the stack) can activate [Livewire Lash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Livewire Lash) when its attached to a creature? If so, my infected lash deck could really use these guys.   
  
Also quite excellent with [Twisted Image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twisted Image), play the Exarch, untap your land, twist him to become a formidable 4/1, and draw your card, oh and of couse, WHENEVER YOU WANT! Throw on a pair of [Swiftfoot Boots](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swiftfoot Boots) (preferably on the battlefield, of course) for a nice 4/1, flash, haste, hexproof, for 4 mana.
